TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE , a building society ( “ the plaintiff ” ) lodged civil action no . CARDINAL in ORG of GPE against the applicant ’s mother claiming an amount of QUANTITY ( “ ORG ” ) for work done and for which the applicant ’s mother had refused to pay on the ground that the plaintiff had failed to produce a certificate from the architect that the work had in fact been carried out .

The Government submit that the plaintiff had made the applicant a party to the action , naming him as defendant CARDINAL in the relevant writ of summons and serving him with the writ , not in his personal capacity , but in his capacity as representative of his mother , PERSON , and of PERSON . According to the power of attorney , the applicant was duly authorised to act on their behalf in the proceedings . As from DATE , following the death of PERSON and in accordance with a court order made in pursuance of an application filed by the plaintiff , the title of the action was amended and the applicant was made a defendant in his capacity as administrator of the estate of the deceased PERSON as well as in his capacity as representative of PERSON .
The applicant filed his defence on DATE , after having applied CARDINAL times for an extension of the time - limit . These extensions were granted with the plaintiff ’s consent .
On DATE the applicant ’s mother submitted a counterclaim for the sum of ORG CARDINAL for building defects and delays .
The pleadings were completed on DATE . On DATE ORG set down the case for directions for DATE .
The hearing fixed for DATE was adjourned by ORG to DATE . An interim application filed by the applicant on DATE was adjourned CARDINAL times with the consent of the parties and then granted on DATE .

The hearing was fixed for DATE . However , on that date it was adjourned first until DATE and then until DATE . On that last date the applicant proposed a further adjournment in order to modify his defence . He filed the modified defence on DATE . On CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE ORG adjourned the hearing for want of time .

On DATE both parties requested the adjournment of the hearing fixed for that date in order to refer the case to arbitration . However , on DATE the applicant changed his mind and the court set down the action for a hearing on CARDINAL DATE . On DATE the hearing commenced , but it was again adjourned at the applicant ’s request in order to prepare the defence in the light of the testimony given by a witness for the plaintiff .

The hearing was fixed for DATE . However , it was adjourned twice at the applicant ’s request until DATE . In the meantime , there had been a change to the composition of ORG and the action , already heard in part , was fixed for a hearing de novo for CARDINAL DATE . Subsequently , the hearing was again adjourned at the request of the applicant ’s lawyer or the plaintiff ’s lawyer .

On DATE the hearing was adjourned owing to the death of PERSON , which necessitated the filing of an application by the plaintiff to amend the title of the action . The pleadings with the amended title were closed on DATE . On DATE the applicant wrote to the court asking it to schedule the hearing for a date sometime after DATE . He gave as his reason that he would be abroad up until that time . The court set down the case for directions on DATE and fixed the date of the hearing for DATE . The hearing commenced on DATE , but was adjourned until DATE upon the plaintiff ’s request . It had to be again adjourned until DATE owing to pressure of business of ORG . It was further adjourned until DATE upon the joint request of the parties and again until DATE . On that last date the court adjourned the action for directions following the applicant ’s request that the case be scheduled to be heard after the DATE recess as the appointed referee was absent abroad and was not expected to return within DATE .

The action was again adjourned twice for directions until DATE and DATE on the joint application of the parties in order to enable the referee to complete his report . The report was eventually prepared on DATE . On DATE , the date on which the directions hearings was to take place , the applicant failed to appear before ORG . On DATE he filed an application seeking a court order to set aside the referee ’s report . The action was again adjourned twice pending the outcome of this application . The hearing on the application was held on DATE . Following this hearing , the parties agreed to set aside the referee ’s report and to appoint an arbitrator by agreement . On DATE ORG of its own motion fixed the case for directions for DATE and gave notice to the parties to appear before it on that date .

On DATE ORG stated that , in view of the fact that the applicant had failed over the course of DATE to make an application to have the action set down for hearing and that the parties had failed to fulfil their undertaking of CARDINAL DATE to appoint an arbitrator , it had to determine whether to dismiss both the action and counterclaim . On DATE ORG decided to set down the action for trial in view of the applicant ’s declared wish not to have recourse to arbitration .

ORG accordingly fixed the action to be heard de novo on DATE , having regard to the parties’ proposal of DATE to have the hearing date fixed for DATE . However , the hearing was adjourned until DATE and again until DATE at the request of the parties . On that last date the hearing was adjourned again as a result of the withdrawal of the plaintiff ’s lawyer . On DATE the court fixed the hearing for DATE . However , on CARDINAL DATE the parties agreed to submit the dispute to arbitration and designated an arbitrator by agreement .
On DATE the decision of the arbitrator was delivered and confirmed by ORG .
